projects.name: Together Apart
projects.subtitle: Co-Designing A Robot Interface for Remote Co-Design
projects.abstract: We collaborate with KidsTeam UW to design a system for remote and hybrid co-design. We utilize Sony toio robots to build a tangible networked robotic system that child designers and their adult design partners can use to collaborate in real time.

projects.name: Presence Mat
projects.subtitle: Low-Cost Room-Scale Radar for the Home with Off The Shelf Hardware
projects.abstract: We design and build a system to utilize off the shelf ultra-high frequency RFID to create a room-scale radar system. This system utilizes deep learning techniques to detect body position and human activity in the sensing area.

projects.name: Cyber Garden
projects.subtitle: Ambient Community Wellness Display
projects.abstract: We create a tangible display to engage graduate students and faculty in reflecting on their stress through self-reporting and biometric measurements. We utilize insights collected during a participatory design workshop with graduate students to create a system to engage the community in conversation and reflection about stress and burnout.

projects.name: Scent Bots
projects.subtitle: Automatic Roving Scents for Ambient Telepresence using Object Recognition
projects.abstract: With Scent Bots, we experiment with spatial smell in a telepresence context. Using a top down camera and object recognition algorithm, the position and smell of an item placed on a remote co-worker's tabletop can be simulated on a user's desk. Through this system, we provide a sense of ambient presence for remote coworking contexts.

projects.name: DOT
projects.subtitle: Device for Spontaneous Object Based Telepresence
projects.abstract: We propose a platform that utilizes tabletop swarm robots to create a tangible telepresent display. The system recognizes the identity of objects placed on the surface, and mirrors their configuration on a paired display. In basing our platform on swarm robots, we create a scalable, portable tangible interface. This project was created for the 2021 UIST Student Innovation Challenge.

projects.name: VTTV
projects.subtitle: Vibrotactile Tongue Display
projects.abstract: VTTV is a seven segment vibrotactile tongue display that allows users to combine taste and vibration to create works of tangible art. We demonstrate VTTV with games as well a free creation mode. The system is intended to provide a unique platform for crafting playful, flavorful, vibrotactile experiences. This project recieved honorable mention in the Student Innovation Challenge at World Haptics Conference 2020.

projects.name: Everything Instrument
projects.subtitle: Turn Anything Into an Instrument
projects.abstract: For the SynthU 2021 hackathon, we presented Everything Instrument, a platform that allows people to turn anything into an instrument using copper tape. After applying copper tape to everyday household objects, users attach their creation to Everything Instrument, using buttons to customize the pitch and character of their sound.
